result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David J. NEUSER

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.
The State moves to dismiss and read in.  Defendant plead to charges of disorderly conduct and bail jumping in 15 CM 156 and 15 CM 352.  Motion granted.
$50.00 cash bail transferred to 15 CM 352 and applied to court costs.
Minutes.
Plea date is reset to 10-14-15 at 11:00 a.m.
The request was not filed timely.
records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign denied

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.   
Not guilty plea.   Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 09-16-15 at 10:45 a.m.   Plea date is set for 11-04-15 at 9:20 a.m.    
Minutes.

At 2:15 p.m., $50.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash bail.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-24-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $50.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, report to the Manitowoc County Jail, daily, by 3:30 p.m. and submit to PBT as requested and maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
